sentence.Network_en: Infringement of the regulation is punishable by a fine.
They see it as an infringement on their own freedom of action.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们把它视为对他们行动自由的侵犯。

sentence.Network_cn: 可能存在违反规章制度的现象。

list.abs: BBC Learning English ... wilfully 故意的 copyright infringement 侵犯版权 intention 意图/目的.
...商标的右上角或右下角带有?字样就说明该商标registered（已经注册），其他人再注册就算trademark infringement（商标侵权）了；而™字样只是表明该标志为此类商品的“商标”，并不代表registered这个状态。不.
二是帮助侵权 (contributory infringement),系帮助他人进行直接侵权之人所应承担的法律责任,其构成要件为:帮助侵权人主观上知道直接.

entry.def: An infringement is an action or situation that interferes with your rights and the freedom you are entitled to.

example.ex: They see it as an infringement on their own freedom of action.
example.tran: 他们把它视为对他们行动自由的侵犯。

entry.def: An infringement of a law or rule is the act of breaking it or disobeying it.

example.ex: There might have been an infringement of the rules...
example.tran: 可能存在违反规章制度的现象。

example.ex: Infringement of the regulation is punishable by a fine.

means.word_mean: 1. an act that disregards an agreement or a right;

sentences.sentence: "he claimed a violation of his rights under the Fifth Amendment"

means.word_mean: 2. a crime less serious than a felony

Sentence.sentence: Monsanto accused Bowman of patent infringement and won an $84,456 damage award

sentences.en: Infringement of this regulation would automatically rule you out of the championship.
sentences.cn: 违背这一规则会被自动取消参加锦标赛的资格。

sentences.en: The committee ruled that the US ban constituted an infringement of free trade.
sentences.cn: 委员会裁定美国的禁令对自由贸易构成了侵犯。
